image.altText: A photo of two people, leaning on a farm fence and looking at the camera, at their rural home

props.synopsis: Richard and Kimberly Byers went from running their own business and living comfortably to being unable to afford groceries, a story charity Foodbank says is becoming all too common.

title.children: From double incomes to 'drowning in debt', households turn to food charity

image.altText: A man with a beard wearing sunglasses takes a selfie

props.synopsis: A woman has told a court how she "watched helplessly" as her partner was set on fire and murdered by his housemate in Adelaide's west more than four years ago. Warning: This story contains content which some readers may find distressing.

title.children: Murder victim set alight in 'act of extreme cruelty', partner tells court

image.altText: Adelaide guard Patrick D'Arcy stands below a basketball backboard holding a basketball

props.synopsis: Patrick D'Arcy is a rising star of Australian basketball. The teenager hopes to one day play professionally after signing a four-year deal to play for East Carolina University.

title.children: Adelaide rising star shoots his way into lucrative world of US college basketball

image.altText: A man with short grey hair wearing a vest and wetsuit.

props.synopsis: A tourism survey finds about 40 per cent of South Australian businesses impacted by the toxic algal bloom have experienced a downturn in trade as the government's financial support is starting to flow to those affected.Â

title.children: Algal bloom and 'negative perceptions' affecting SA tourism, survey finds

image.altText: a teenage girl with long blonde hair and her mother who had dark brown hair, standing cheek to cheek and smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Polycystic ovary syndrome affects between 6 and 13 per cent of women, but its name has been labelled misleading. An Australian-led initiative is pushing for a global change.

title.children: PCOS sufferers call for 'misleading' name to be changed

image.altText: The underside of two wind turbine blades in helix form attached to the top of a pole with wires

props.synopsis: A small-scale wind turbine has been developed in Adelaide in the hope of supplying energy direct to off-grid users, including farms, wineries and construction sites.

title.children: Wind turbine trial sparks hope as small-scale power source

image.altText: Former South Australian state Labor MP Annabel Digance.

props.synopsis: A South Australian court did not find former MP Annabel Digance and her husband guilty of blackmailing Premier Peter Malinauskas, despite a previous claim by the premier's lawyer in court, a leaked email obtained by ABC News reveals.

title.children: âCourt record is incorrectâ: Ex-MP accused of blackmailing SA Premier was not found guilty

image.altText: Chris Picton speaks with a man in a wheelchair as a woman watches on in a hotel room converted with a hospital bed

props.synopsis: As South Australia records its worst ambulance ramping, one of the ways the government is tackling the problem is by moving patients from hospitals to a hotel.

title.children: Ambulance ramping reaches record high in South Australia amid flu season

image.altText: A large circular formation of bleached coral underwater.

props.synopsis: In Western Australia, the damage to coral reefs including the World Heritage-listed Ningaloo has eclipsed any previous bleaching events.Â

title.children: From 'hope spot' to 'skeletons': Ningaloo's 'catastrophic' event

image.altText: A woman leaning on white boxes filled with jujubes.

props.synopsis: Jujubes boast high nutritional values and thousands of years of versatile use in Asia, and farmers are determined to put them on consumers' plates.

title.children: Farmers bet on nutritionally rich jujubes becoming next food trend

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks at the White House while holding a paper showing a graph.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says his administration is seizing control of the Washington DC police department and deploying the National Guard to crack down on local crime and "clear" the city of homelessness.

title.children: Trump plans Washington police takeover to 'rescue' city from crime

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks to Vladimir Putin standing next to him.

props.synopsis: This week marks the first time Russian President Vladimir Putin has set foot on American soil in almost a decade â but the place he's meeting Donald Trump once belonged to Russia.

title.children: Here's why Trump and Putin picked Alaska for their first meeting in years

image.altText: Two large boats collide near a third vessel which they are chasing on open ocean

props.synopsis: Video shows the moment a Chinese vessel hits the front of the other while on the open sea.

title.children: Fate of Chinese crew unknown after dramatic collision in South China Sea

image.altText: A blue board shows a photo of Epstein and Maxwell hugging, beside a series of dot-pointed text. A hand points to the photo..

props.synopsis: The New York judge said the government's assertion the materials â transcripts of witness testimony heard by the grand jury that indicted Maxwell â would reveal meaningful new information was "demonstrably false".

title.children: Judge rejects Trump administration's bid to unseal Ghislaine Maxwell transcripts

image.altText: Robert F Kennedy Kr in a black suit and tie sitting at a table while speaking and gesturing with his hands

props.synopsis: Under the watch of Health Secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr, a vaccine-preventable disease has continued to spread across the United States.

title.children: US on the brink of major public health failure

image.altText: Mima McKim-Hill

props.synopsis: Mima McKim-Hill was murdered in Central Queensland in 1967. Over half a century later, her suspected killer has never faced justice.

title.children: Mima McKim-Hill died in 1967. Her suspected killer never faced justice

image.altText: An illustration of a young boy staring at a computer. He is surrounded by text bubbles.

props.synopsis: An investigation by triple j hack uncovers allegations of young people in Australia being sexually harassed and even encouraged to take their own life by AI chatbots.

title.children: Young Australian hospitalised after ChatGPT use

image.altText: Still from video of near miss between train and ute at Tasmanian rail crossing.

props.synopsis: The latest compilation video of near misses is released, as part of a plea to Tasmanian drivers and pedestrians to do better at rail crossings â with the grim warning that trains "do not apologise".

title.children: Trains 'do not apologise': Videos of close calls released in plea for safety

image.altText: A police officer with their head and face covered holds a gun beside a plain clothes officer outside a house with police tape.

props.synopsis: Heavily armed police swarm a house in Melbourne's south-east after the bodies of the man and woman were discovered.

title.children: Man arrested at railway station after two found dead in Mount Waverley

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: Hermes handbags, multiple properties, cash and a Rolex watch receipt for $24,000, are alleged to be part of the "unexplained wealth" of a Chinese national charged with reckless foreign interference in Canberra last week.

title.children: Court hears woman accused of foreign interference has 'unexplained wealth'

image.altText: A husband and wife walking towards court, with lawyers standing either side of them.

props.synopsis: A Supreme Court jury has heard the helicopter pilot involved in a fatal 2022 crash â killing Matt Wright's Netflix co-star â had a reputation as "a party animal" and had been a frequent drug user.

title.children: Pilot disconnected flight meter to cover 'fishing, partying', Supreme Court hears

image.altText: Kathleen Folbigg gives an interview to NBN

props.synopsis: Speaking out for the first time after the NSW government's payout offer, Kathleen Folbigg says the lack of transparency around how the sum was calculated has left her feeling "confused" and "shocked".

title.children: 'A slap in the face': Kathleen Folbigg speaks out against $2m payout

image.altText: Penny Wong looks at Anthony Albanese at a press confernece

props.synopsis: You need only look to the windows overlooking the prime minister's courtyard to know Australia was about to mark a milestone moment in recognising a Palestinian state.

title.children: PM's Palestine pledge unexpectedly became quintessentially Australian

image.altText: A serious-looking man wearing a helmet and flak-jacket with "PRESS" printed on it, holding a microphone.

props.synopsis: Al Jazeera says a group of its correspondents and camera crew have been killed in an Israeli strike on their tent in Gaza City.

title.children: Israel kills Al Jazeera journalists in Gaza air strike

image.altText: Nat Fyfe

props.synopsis: Dual Brownlow medallist Nat Fyfe has confirmed he will retire at the end of the 2025 AFL season.

title.children: 'I don't need anything further': Nat Fyfe to retire at end of AFL season

image.altText: A woman in a white shirt smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: After Catherine Ridley was bitten under her blanket by a highly venomous snake in a remote WA desert community, she made a frantic dash of more than 70 kilometres to reach medical help.

title.children: Woman faces 'worst nightmare' in being bitten by an outback king brown

image.altText: The Nadesalingam family pose for the photo.

props.synopsis: Checking in with the Tamil family from the small town of Biloela who were at the centre of one of the country's biggest people-power movements of recent years.

title.children: Biloela family isn't taking its ordinary Australian life for granted

image.altText: a baby boy looking into the camera, a towel loosely covering the top of his head and back

props.synopsis: Family day care makes up just 5 per cent of Australia's early childhood education and care system, but insiders, experts and regulatory documents paint a picture of a sector beset by troubling incidents and structural risk.

title.children: Parents of boy who died in family day care urge authorities to 'wake up'

image.altText: A group of people look onto a pile of rubble, a man in high vis stands among the debris.

props.synopsis: An earthquake, with its epicentre in the town of Sindirgi, sends shocks that were felt 200 kilometres to the north in Istanbul â a city of more than 16 million people.

title.children: Deadly TÃ¼rkiye earthquake destroys more than a dozen buildings

image.altText: A silhouette of a woman looking at bills.

props.synopsis: As inflation eases, many Australians are still feeling the impact of the cost of living, with the number of people experiencing financial stress almost doubling since the pandemic.

title.children: As financial strain hits, Australians struggle with money dysmorphia

image.altText: A young woman is pushed in the back of the head by a man in front of a large mob of people.

props.synopsis: A video showing a young woman being jeered at and assaulted by a large group of men as she walks across a university campus in Papua New Guinea is condemned by the university's vice-chancellor and women's rights activists.

title.children: Video of young woman mobbed at PNG university sparks outrage

image.altText: Sign saying 'welcome to Charleville'

props.synopsis: Murweh Shire Council, in south-west Queensland, is investigating after testing found a rare amoeba that can cause a serious brain infection in its water supply.

title.children: Potentially deadly brain-eating amoeba found in Qld shire's drinking water

image.altText: An aerial shot of the University of Western Australia's Crawley campus.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's major universities has suffered a data breach that exposed the password information of thousands of staff and students.

title.children: University of Western Australia suffers major data breach

image.altText: A black and white photo of London, which looks grainy due to fog

props.synopsis: The Great Smog of London spurred the British to fight for better air quality in the 1950s. As concerns about air pollution surface in Australia, some say the incident still holds lessons.Â

title.children: 'I couldn't believe the air quality': From London's Great Smog to Launceston
